intro: Piper atlantidanum var. sibunense, commonly known as the Sibun pepper, is a tropical vine native to Central America. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes many species of pepper plants. The plant produces small, green, egg-shaped fruits that turn red when mature. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a distinctive glossy appearance. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of medicinal compounds.
